ai.summary: Neist Point Lighthouse offers an easy coastal walk of about 3 km round trip along dramatic cliffs on the Isle of Skye. The route rewards visitors with sweeping sea views, basalt stacks, and chances to spot seabirds, making it a popular sunset destination. The terrain is gentle overall, but exposure to wind and uneven surfaces means appropriate footwear and caution near cliff edges are advised.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail is a well-defined coastal path of gravel and compact dirt with some rocky steps. It climbs gently from the car park to the lighthouse and then along a headland with exposed viewpoints. Parts of the route are uneven and windy, with occasional loose scree near the edge.
ai.safety_notes: Coastal weather can change rapidly; check forecast before you go. Stay well back from cliff edges and do not rely on barriers. Wear sturdy footwear and dress in layers; bring a waterproof layer. Mobile reception can be patchy; tell someone your plans and carry a map or offline navigation. Watch for crowds, especially at sunset, and keep dogs under control where allowed.
recommended_gear: Map or offline navigation and a charged phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn (April–October) for milder weather and longer daylight; winter can be windy and changeable.
